episode_title: 714 - The One Where They All Turn Thirty

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is knocking on Rachel’s door, whose door frame is decorated with balloons. The rest of the gang is there as well. Rachel opens the door and the gang blow on noisemakers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Happy birthday!!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Happy birthday!!!
(Rachel glares at them and goes back into her room, closing her door.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Rach! Come on! Rach!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s your birthday!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s not as pretty as she was when she was 29.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Ms. Green would like to establish some ground rules before she comes out. She would appreciate it if you don’t use the words old or downhill or (To Joey) they still look pretty damn good. (Joey smiles and everyone glares at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They do!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel! Come on out! Monica made breakfast!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chocolate-chip pancakes!
(There is no response from Rachel.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’ve got presents!
(She opens the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good ones?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They all came from the list you handed out to us two weeks ago.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, can I keep the presents and still be 29?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Rach! Look, turning thirty is not that big a deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh really. Is that how you felt when you turned thirty?
[Flashback to Joey’s thirtieth birthday party. It is being held in Monica and Chandler’s apartment.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why God?!! Why?!! We had a deal!! Let the others grow old! Not me!! (He buries his head in Phoebe’s lap for comfort.)
[Cut back to Rachel’s party, everyone is now eating breakfast, except Rachel.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I’m still 29 in Guam.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, 30 is not that old! Do you know how old the Earth is?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Late thirties? Oh come on you guys! Is it just me? Am I overreacting to this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No Rach, it’s not just you. My thirtieth birthday certainly wasn’t that much fun.
[Flashback to Chandler’s thirtieth birthday party. It is also being held in Monica and his apartment. He is about to blow out the candles on his birthday cake.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And now Chandler! We’re all gettin’ so old! (Looking up) Why are you doing this to us?! (Turns away crying.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, breakfast is finished but Rachel’s still down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, you’re in a great place in your life. Come on, you’ve got a great job! Good friends…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, your roommate is a soap opera star.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, y’know I know my life’s going pretty well, but I look around and I just see so many people who’ve accomplished so many other goals by the time they’re thirty.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but you shouldn’t compare yourself to me.
[Flashback to: The Street in front of Central Perk, Ross and Joey are holding a yellow tape across the road and everyone is cheering Phoebe as she bounces around the corner on a hippity-hop.]

content.speaker: All
content.text: Come on Phoebe! You can do it Phoebe! Come on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There you go!
(She crosses the line and they all cheer again.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I did it! One mile on a hippity-hop! That’s it!! That’s everything I wanted to do before I was thirty. Oh, except I wanted to patch things up with my sister. But oh well. Yay!! (They all cheer again.) And-and girls this thing is a Godsend if you know what I mean. (Rachel and Monica look intrigued and as they all head into Central Perk, Rachel picks up the hippity-hop that Phoebe left behind.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thirty. Ugh, I mean thirty! Monica, do you remember mean old Mrs. Kreeger in the fifth grade? She was thirty!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Come on, let’s have some fun. Huh? (To Rachel) What do you want to do today?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing. I don’t want to do anything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, doing nothing on your thirtieth is better than doing something stupid, like Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! That was a practical purchase! I needed that car for transportation! Okay? I-I have a child!

[Flashback to: A street, Ross is sitting in his newly purchased MGB. Which is one of the better British sports cars ever made. Of course, ‘better’ is a relative term. Which reminds me of a joke. Why don’t the British make computers? Because they couldn’t figure out how to make them leak oil. Anyway, the gang is all staring at his new purchase.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How hot do I look in this, huh?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross, a sports car? Wouldn’t it have been cheaper to just stuff a sock down there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s not what this is about okay? I-I am a sports car enthusiast. I have always been into cars.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what’s the horsepower on this thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, but-but look how shiny!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you bought this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really! God Ross, what were you thinking? (To Phoebe, quietly) I know it’s really shallow, but a part of me wants him again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well get in line missy. (To Ross) So, can I have a ride stud?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hop in. (Phoebe hops in.) Get ready for the smoothest ride of your life.

(He starts the car and surprisingly it fires right up and comes to a nice idle. (Both can be rarities with British sports cars with their lovely Lucas ignition systems, which tend not to work, especially in the rain.) Anyway, this being New York he is parallel parked on a street with the car in front of him only inches ahead of his bumper, likewise with the car behind him. He’s completely boxed in and can’t move more than two inches. He tries to get out several times by bumping the bumpers of both cars to no avail.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damnit! (Shuts the car off.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, who’s next?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Phoebe is pouring Rachel some coffee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? I am going to do something today. I’m not just gonna sit around like some old lady. I’m gonna get something pierced. Like my uh, like my nose or my tongue or something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! ‘Cause y’know that hurts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what?! Y’know what? The way I see it—(Phoebe pulls out a hair from the back of her head)—Ow! Son of a bitch!!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Look Rachel, I know what you’re going through. I’m totally freaked about turning 25.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Get out, get out of my apartment.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right Rach, for what it’s worth, I think that you’re doing great. I mean y’know let’s face it, no one handles this well.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Least of all you.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Why? What you’d do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Weren’t you asked to leave sonny?
[Flashback to Monica and Chandler’s apartment. Chandler has a bunch of people over in formal wear to give Monica a surprise birthday party. Joey is coming out of the bathroom and removing his tie.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you put that back on?! Monica’s gonna be here any minute!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it hurt’s my Joey’s Apple.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, for the last time. It’s not named for each individual man.
(Joey walks away and Mr. and Mrs. Geller walk up. Mr. Geller is wearing this ancient velvet tuxedo.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You’ve done a wonderful job with this party Chandler. Everything looks so lovely.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh well, not as lovely as you. I mean, I can’t believe that you would have a thirty-year-old daughter! (To Mr. Geller) And you! I can’t believe that you would have a tux that’s thirty years old! (Puts his hand on Mr. Geller’s shoulder.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: It’s older than that. Ross was actually conceived right near this tuxedo.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh! (He quickly removes his hand and looks at it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Everybody hide! Hide! I saw her! She’s coming!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! Okay! Everybody down! Everybody down! (Rachel turns off the lights and everyone crouches. As everyone crouches, a ripping noise erupts from the assemblage.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Crap.
(We hear some fumbling at the door, then silence.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, everybody stay here. I will find out what’s going on.
(He goes out into the hall and finds a very drunk Monica lying up against Joey and Rachel’s door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Heyyy!! You got the door open!! (Giggles.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey are you drunk?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooo! (Giggles) Okay. (She tries to pull herself up by Rachel and Joey’s doorknob, but the door opens and she almost falls into the their apartment. She manages to catch herself.) Whoa! (Stands up, unsteadily) Okay. See I was, I was a little nervous about turning (whispering) thirty. (Giggles.) So the bus boys took me out for some drinks. (Pause) I wanna puke on you later!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, here is the thing. We have thrown a very formal surprise party for you in there! All of your friends are in there and your parents!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no! My parents have never seen me drunk! (Pause) That they know of.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, here’s the thing. We’re gonna get you some coffee and they will never know that you’re drunk.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?! You promise?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’ll take care of it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I love you so much. (Kisses him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay we have to do something about your breath.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about your breath?! (Breathes on him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s still yours. Okay, now remember it’s a surprise party. So, when you go in, act surprised.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I can do that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(Chandler opens the door and Monica sneaks up on it. They go inside.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Surprise!!!
(Monica screams and they all stare at her.)

content.description: Ross’s birthday, Joey is now trying to get his car out while Ross is directing him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, forward. Forward—Stop! (The car moves an inch and Ross runs to the back of the car.) Okay, back—Stop! (The car barely moves and Ross runs back to the front.) Okay, forward—Stop! Stop! Stop!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, just forget about it. This guy’s got you totally wedged in.
(A beautiful woman approaches.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Is this yours?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well actually…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no! It’s mine! It’s-it’s mine. (The woman walks away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, you soooo need this car.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Okay, here’s what we’re gonna do. Okay, I’m gonna break into this mini-van and put it in neutral. You guys push it forward so Ross can drive out of his spot. Okay? All right, here we go. (She opens her coat and reveals that thing car thieves use to break into cars as Ross jumps in behind the wheel. She inserts the device, unlocks the door, opens it, and the alarm goes off.) Haul ass!!!! (Runs off.)
(The rest of the gang runs away, except for Ross who’s tramped inside his car. To hide he puts the top up as Monica, Rachel, and Joey come running past.)

content.description: Phoebe’s birthday, she’s taking the hippity-hop to Ursula’s apartment as a gift. She knocks on the door and Ursula answers it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy thirtieth birthday! Here! (Hands her the hippity-hop.) It’s for the child in you, and the woman. Happy thirtieth!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right, why do you keep saying that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because it’s our thirtieth birthday.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, no we’re not thirty. We’re 31. Okay. (She closes the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait! (Knocks on the door and Ursula opens it.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Oh, it’s you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. What?!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, we’re not thirty, we’re 31.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nu-uh!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yea-huh! That’s what is says on my birth certificate.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You have your birth certificate?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, I got a big box of family stuff when my mom died.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Our mom.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right! Okay. (Hands Phoebe her births certificate.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you have my birth certificate?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: No, I sold it to a Swedish runaway.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God, we are 31.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just lost a whole year of my life.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your middle name is Pamela?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I never knew mine. Do you remember what it is?

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yes! Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s my first name.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Right, okay, then no.

content.description: Monica’s birthday, it’s just after the surprise.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay before we start the celebration, Monica has to go put on her party dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See? (Does his laugh.) Here we go. (Starts walking her to their room, and has to pass in front of Mr. Geller who’s sitting at the table and Mrs. Geller who’s standing next to him.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Happy birthday, sweetie! Give us a hug! (Starts to get up.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Don’t get up Jack! The safety pins are about to blow.
(They continue their trek.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Paul!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phil.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phil!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now, there is a dress laid out on your bed. (Monica stumbles on the steps.) Okay, (catches her) you’re doing great. You’re doing great. You’re doing fine.
(Phoebe approaches as they almost get to their room.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica’s a little drunk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay! I love drunk Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Awwwww… (Giggles.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Go change! (To Phoebe) She doesn’t want her parents to know she’s drunk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! All right! All right. Here’s what we’ll do, I’ll get twice as drunk as Monica and then no one will even notice her.
(Chandler walks over to where the rest of the gang is.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s-what’s going on? Phil’s really pissed!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica’s wasted.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe that will liven up this party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, will you just go help her change please!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, but taking care of a drunk, naked woman seems like a job for Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep. (Starts for Monica’s room, but Chandler stops him.)

content.description: Rachel’s birthday, everyone is presenting their presents to Rachel.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: This one’s from me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: It wasn’t on your list, but hopefully you’ll think it’s really fun.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A scooter! (She’s not happy.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Stick to the list. Always stick to the list.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No-no, I love it. Thank you. (Kisses him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, open ours next. Open ours next!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now that you’re a couple, we don’t get two presents from you guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: For my last birthday you gave me a hug ! (To Rachel) Okay, read the card! Read the card!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Opens the card and reads it.) Happy birthday Grandma! It’s better to be over the hill (starting to cry) then buried under it. (Breaks down as everyone glares at them.) All our love Monica and Chandler. (Crying) That’s funny, yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no! That was the joke!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I know! I get it! It’s funny!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, because you’re not a grandmother!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No I know, because to be a grandmother you have to be married and have children and I don’t have any of those things. That’s why it’s so funny. (Runs into her room crying.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All you had to do was buy the card!

content.description: Rachel’s birthday, a time lapse has occurred. Rachel is coming back into the living room carrying a notepad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Look who’s back! It’s the birthday girl! How’s the birthday girl feeling?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I feel fine, but I think you’re bumming out the rest of the kids.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (Glances over and sees the faces of the rest of the group, then goes and sits down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! Y’know what? I realized it was stupid to get upset about not having a husband and kids. All I really needed was a plan. See I wanna have three kids…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh let me guess, and you wanna have them all at the same time and you wanna have them for your brother.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: As I was saying… I should probably have the first of the three kids by the time I’m 35 which gives me five years. I love this plan! I wanna marry this plan!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If you could do that, I’d marry the hippity-hop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, if I wanna have my kid when I’m 35, I don’t have to get pregnant until I’m 34. Which gives Prada four years to start making maternity clothes! Oh wait, but I do want to be married for a year before I get pregnant…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really! That long?! (Chandler slowly turns and looks at her.) (To Chandler) Look all you want, it’s happening!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, so I don’t have to get married until I’m 33! That’s three years, that’s three whole years—Oh, wait a minute though. I’ll need a year and a half to plan the wedding, and I’d like to know the guy for a year, year and a half before we get engaged… Which means I need to meet the guy by the time I’m thirty.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Which is fine! Because you just turned—(Removes two candles from the cake)—twenty-eight!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Ross, no! It is not fine! Eh-eh-according to my plan I should already be with the guy I wanna marry!
(We hear Tag scream out in the hallway and jump into view of the open door on the scooter. He gives a hearty thumbs up to the group and rides off, with Joey following breathlessly behind.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Will you quit hoggin’ it!

content.description: Monica’s birthday, Monica is now dressed and is being helped out by Chandler and Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m telling you it’s like watching Bambi learn how to walk.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re drunk! Mom and dad are gonna be maaaaadd! Maybe I’m a little drunk.
(Monica sits down on the barcalounger.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s great! Right there! Can we get some of that over here please? (The waiter comes over) There we go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Are those crab cakes? (The waiter nods) Did I not tell ya to come straight to me when more crab cakes were ready?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How are you feeling?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You are so handsome! I wanna make love to you right here, right now! (Growls and pulls him into a kiss.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I really wish that you wouldn’t.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now all you have to do is just get through a little bit more, okay? Then we can put you in bed, okay? Just smile and don’t talk to any one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Speech! Speech! Let’s hear from the birthday girl! Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t you see? Everyone’s looking at me! The plan’s working! I didn’t even have to take off my top yet!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Speech! Come on Monica!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Come on! Speech!
(Monica stands up and wobbles slightly and Chandler runs over to catch her.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hey Chandler, you can’t keep your hands off her for one second!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh-ho, I think it’s nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s necessary. (Backs away anyhow.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I-I wanna thank you all for coming. My family and my friends…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wooo!! Hoo!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I really like to say that I’m-um… (Pause) Y’know what I’d really like to say? I’m drunk!! (Mrs. Geller pulls the camera down.) That’s right mom and dad your little Harmonica is hammered!! (Ross grabs the camera out of his dad’s hands.) And guess what! I’ve been drunk before! And I’ve smoked a cigarette! And I got a box of Ding-Dongs hidden in my underwear drawer! It’s all okay. It’s okay because I turned thirty today. And, and I can do anything I want! Because I am a grown up. (Falls over sideways with Ross filming the fall.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay quick, help me get this off! (Motions to her top.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!!
(Ross pans the camera over to Phoebe.)

content.description: Phoebe’s birthday, she’s telling everyone what she found out at Ursula’s while sitting in Central Perk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I lost a whole year! I can’t believe it! This is so unfair!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I don’t know Pheebs. It’ll be okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Will it? Will it?! I mean, how would you feel if you found out you were 31?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not gonna happen. No. (Looks up) Because we have a new deal!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Plus, it totally ruined my schedule! I…I haven’t done any of the things I wanted to do by the time I was 31!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Like okay I-I-I, I haven’t met any Portuguese people! I, I haven’t had the perfect kiss! And I haven’t been to sniper’s school!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, y’know why don’t we just go upstairs and have some birthday cake?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I just feel like being by myself for a while. All right? I’ll see you guys later. Thanks. (Gets up and exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey. (After she leaves.) Oh, poor Pheebs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, y’know what you guys? I think I’m gonna go walk her home. (Gets up and runs out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s gonna eat the cake!
[Cut outside, Joey is catching up with Phoebe.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs! Wait up! (She stops.) Listen uh, close your eyes. (She does so and Joey passionately kisses her.) Maybe that’s one thing you can cross off your list.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah.
(Joey starts to walk away, but stops.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, and plus I’m 1/16 th Portuguese.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! (Phoebe walks away smiling.)

content.description: Ross’s birthday, his car is still trapped in its spot. Now Joey, Phoebe, and Ross are at the front of the car with Monica, Rachel, and Chandler at the rear of the car.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, is everybody clear? We’re gonna pick it up…and move it. Now all we need is teamwork, okay? We’re gonna lift the car…and slide it out. Lift and slide!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I really don’t think…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Lift!! And slide!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, here we go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right everyone, lift! (They try to lift the car, of course it doesn’t raise up) And slide!! (Everyone leans over, but the car still does not move.)

content.description: Rachel’s birthday, she is coming into the hallway where Joey and Tag are playing with the scooter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Joey, can I…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, come on Rach! My turn just started!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Actually, I just wanna talk to Tag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Okay. Hey, can I ride this outside?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whatever! Okay, I’m not your mother.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! (Runs off downstairs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not in the street!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: How are you doing? Are you feeling any better?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m doing okay. I’m um…let’s talk.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Okay. (They sit on the step.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm…

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh Tag, umm…you’re such a great guy and we have sooo much fun together but I don’t-I don’t…

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Wait! I think I see where you’re going, but before you say anything else, can I just say one more thing? (Kisses her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well said. And a uh good example of the fun I was referring to uhh, but I just think I’m past the point where I think I can y’know, just have fun.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Rachel, don’t do this. This is just because you’re turning thirty.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it is! But you’re just a kid! I mean you’re 25!

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Twenty-four actually.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God! Y’know what I wish? I wish you were six years older. Well actually, if I’m wishin’ for stuff, I actually wish I was six years younger.

content.speaker: Tag
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m sorry. (They hug.)
[Time lapse, Rachel is entering her apartment after breaking up with Tag.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! How’d it go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, if I only want two kids, can I keep him for another year?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You did the right thing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t like this anymore. (He sits down with them in pain.)
content.parenthetical: entering, limping, and holding his arm

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, here we are, just a bunch of thirty year olds.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: God, do you realize in ten years we’re gonna be 40?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why God?! Why are you doing this to us?! (He buries his head in Ross’s shoulder.)

content.description: Ross’s birthday, night has fallen and Joey and Ross are walking by where his car is parked to find that both cars blocking him in have left.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! My baby’s finally free!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All-all right! (They run and jump in the car.) Start it up! Let’s go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Woohoo!
(Just as they are about to pull away, a big, fat, bald guy pulls up in the exact same car as Ross and stops next to him.)

content.speaker: The Man In The Sportscar
content.text: How hot are we? (He drives off.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You wanna buy a car?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.
(Ross shuts it off and they get out.)
{Transcriber’s Note: There was no credits scene with this episode.}
